SEARCH:
Package game

Klasse Logger

java.lang.Object
game.Logger
public class Logger extends Object
The Logger class is responsible for logging game-related data in the simulation mode. The following data as getting logged: passed cards, hand cards after passing, played tricks, round points, and game points. The logged data can be exported to a CSV file.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • Logger

      public Logger(int numberOfGames)
      Initializes a new Logger with the specified number of games.
      Parameter:
      numberOfGames - The number of games to be logged.

  • Methodendetails

    • exportData

      public void exportData(String fileName)
      Exports the logged data to a CSV file with the specified file name.
      Parameter:
      fileName - The name of the CSV file to export the data to.

    • logCardsPassed

      public void logCardsPassed(int[] passOfPlayer)
      Logs the passed cards for each player in a round.
      Parameter:
      passOfPlayer - the cards passed by each player.

    • logHandCardsAfterPassing

      public void logHandCardsAfterPassing(Player[] players)
      Logs the hand cards after passing for each player in a round.
      Parameter:
      players - the players in the game.

    • logTrickPlayed

      public void logTrickPlayed(Trick trick)
      Logs the played trick in a round.
      Parameter:
      trick - the played trick.

    • logRoundPoints

      public void logRoundPoints(Player[] players)
      Logs the current round points for all players in a round.
      Parameter:
      players - An array of Player objects representing the players in the game.

    • logGamePoints

      public void logGamePoints(Player[] players)
      Logs the current game points for all players after a round.
      Parameter:
      players - An array of Player objects representing the players in the game.

    • evenSizeOfPassedEntries

      public void evenSizeOfPassedEntries()
      Adjusts the entries of cardsPassed and handCardsAfterPassing so that the next passed cards are in the correct row of the CSV.

    • handleNoPass

      public void handleNoPass()
      Adjust the number of entries in no pass mode.

    • logGameStatistic

      public void logGameStatistic(Player[] players) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Logs game statistics, especially how often each player has secured each position (1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th) in the game. This information is logged after completing a game.
      Parameter:
      players - The players of the game.
      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the players array does not have exactly 4 elements.
